Removing a Group

The application allows only empty groups to be deleted. Before removing a group, you must either delete all users from the group or move the users to another group. As a result, no user accounts are removed from the server configuration.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To remove a group:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the User Manager shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > User Manager.

    The User Manager dialog opens.

  4. Select a group from the Groups tree.

  5. Right-click to open the context menu, and select Delete. The system displays the following message. Do you want to delete group groupname?

  6. Click Yes. The system removes the group from the Groups tree.

  7. Click OK.

Note: If the group contains users, the system displays the following message:
The group you want to delete contains user accounts. Please delete these user accounts or move them to another group prior to deleting a group.
If you see this message, click OK. Then either delete the users in this group or move them to another group. After performing this task, proceed with the group delete instructions.
